Title.evidence: Evaluation of PERCIST in Predicting Pathologic Response in NSCLC: A Retrospective Study

Participants.evidence: 130 patients from the Setouchi Lung Cancer Group who underwent FDG-PET imaging before and after induction therapy prior to planned surgical resection for NSCLC between 2007 and 2016

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates the predictive value of Positron Emission Tomography Response Criteria in Solid Tumors (PERCIST) for pathologic response.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was pathologic complete response (pCR), measured postoperatively.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Pathologic studies revealed pCR in 42 (32.3%) patients.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The sensitivity, specificity, and accuracy of PERCIST for predicting pCR were 16.7%, 88.6%, and 65.4%, respectively.
